name: Peppers Craigieburn

reviews.text: We stayed at this resort fully aware of the other travellers have experienced. It wasn't as bad as it was made out to be but also not fantastic.
reviews.title: Its a bit meh

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room sizes were on the small side, not tiny but definately not spacious. The quality of the services in the rooms definately aren't of the 4 star quality (no in room movies etc) but we were told snootily by the staff in the hotel that these basic services will be rolled out to the whole hotel shortly.
reviews.title: Not worth the money

reviews.text: We all found the staff to be rude and seemed to be looking down on us. In particular was a rather short attitude to us at breakfast which made us feel like petulant children when all we wanted to do was sit down and have breakfast. The food was on the sparse side, pretty poor quality (cordial was being passed off as OJ, eggs were powdered) and took a long time to come out from the kitchen.
reviews.title: Great space for business conferences

likes.liked: — wayne and his hot chocolate skills
likes.disliked: — too many conferences at the same time

reviews.text: Grounds, the setting is nice over the golf course and parking is a lot easier than it is at Milton Park.
reviews.title: So bad... we left the next day

likes.liked: — It was only 1 hour away from home and only 5 minutes away from the Centennial Winery

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would I stay there again? Probably not, we got a deal on wotif $189 including breakfast which made it expensive but not over the top for Bowral. I would feel pretty ripped off if I paid the rack rate. The facilities at the hotel are very limited in the evenings so you would need to take something to keep you occupied. Its ok, not great but if you can get a deal and your going for a night then I would probably stay there. If not I'm sure there are better places in Bowral to stay.
reviews.title: Very dissapointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in Cragieburn over the Easter weekend for 2 nights. Service was fantastic and the hotel was nice and new. The staff was really friendly and nice. The room looked excellent at first, and everything was very new. The surroundings were simply beautiful too. But we soon realised that the room was really tiny for the two of us and the bathroom was really tiny too, I think it measured something like 1m x 4 m all in all? The fan was really loud and there was absolutely no space to put toiletries... The worst thing we realised was that the water pressure in the showerhead was really terrible. It was a miserable task getting a shower.
reviews.title: Disappointing...

reviews.text: The king sized bed took up a lot of space in the room. There was also a couch at the opposite wall to the bed. The couch was good to sit on for a read, except that there wasn't any reading lights. It was also awkwardly positioned. It was a sort of reclining couch... I would have prefered if I could recline in the direction facing the television set and read at the same time. Instead, the couch reclined in a position where my back was towards the TV and facing a huge mirror.
reviews.title: Nice outside but some surprises

likes.liked: — Great Location, Views from the main house, Food, Service

reviews.text: Breakfast was included in the hotel fee that we paid, nearly A$300 per night. Breakfast was also quite crap with a limited variety and a lot of which had ran out by the time we went down for breakfast. Even utensils, plates and bowls were not replenished. The breakfast was really disappointing. On the 2nd day, we gave the breakfast a miss.
reviews.title: Not that great
A real disappointment
reviews.text: We have just arrived back from Cragieburn and have some mixed feelings. The property has been recently renovated and looks very modern and sleek inside. Our room ( A Terrace Room??? with no Terrace) was not huge but well furnished, with what seemed like completely new curtains, bed, linen etc.

description: Reflecting the style and elegance of the original homestead, Peppers Craigieburn was originally built in 1887 and welcomed its first guests in 1909. Offering stylish and elegant accommodation, Peppers Craigieburn has a delightful onsite restaurant, tennis court and is the perfect place for a romantic weekend away or a relaxing escape.Within easy reach of Sydney, Canberra and the coast, Peppers Craigieburn is set in an area renowned for its national parks, antique shopping and cool climate wines.
